Name: Azalina's
Address: 499 Ellis St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text:
In rather a rough area so we were surprised by the location. Once we walked through the door though we were transported to a different world. The decoration reminded of Peranakan homes I have seen in Singapore.
You need to reserve in advance and decide if you are going with fixed 2 or 4 course meal. This is not your typical Malaysian nor Straits style food. Truly amazing and by end of the meal you will be full!
Wish I could have had seconds of the trifle desert though!!
On the pricey side as with drinks looking at >$120 per person.
Great choice for a memorable night out.
Poem: Here is the poem referencing the restaurant and review highlights, followed by the most mentioned dish:
Popular Dish/Drink:
Azalina's is quite the find
With flavors that dance and delight the mind
Some bumps along the way  
But the beef cheek makes it a memorable day

beef cheek

Name: b. patisserie
Address: 2821 California St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰5:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰5:00â€¯PM
Review Text: B. Patisserie, on the corner of California and Divisadero you will find heaven on earth. You make your way through a line walking around the large selection of fresh Viennoiseries behind the glass, at the cashier point you can order a fresh to order sandwich and beverage. You are given a number and patiently wait for a table, the tables keep turning, leaving small pastry crust all over, the servers keep cleaning and delivering food; be patient; you will soon be rewarded. l had the chocolate banana almond croissant,  enough for two people to share, it was crispy and golden brown around the edges and the filling was slightly sweet not overpowering chocolate banana filling, soon to be my favorite morning treat while having coffee with my wife. I also ordered the cortado, good quality coffee beans served in a small cup, I could not resist and also ordered the open face Ham and Cheese with sliced French Swiss Cheese and Bechamel, piping hotâ€¦heavenly served on a plate with fork and knife. Enjoy!!!
Poem: Here is the poem referencing the restaurant and reviews, followed by the most mentioned dish:
Popular Dish/Drink:
B Patisserie, a delight
Flaky croissants baked just right
Sweet indulgence day and night
Parisian dreams in our sight
Chocolate bananas take a bite  

chocolate banana croissant

Review Text: My boyfriend and I came here the other night for the first time for our anniversary. We had put on our online reservation that we were celebrating. Bix did such an amazing job ensuring our evening was special with great seating, anniversary card, and a special surprise. The atmosphere and music was great along with the fantastic food. I recommend this spot to anyone looking for a romantic evening. Thanks for the great service, we will be returning!

Name: Californios
Address: 355 11th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Review Text: Every now and then there is that one dinner experience that is perfect from start to finish. Californios was one of those for me. The restaurant interior is beautifully decorated with interesting art works. Service is warm and friendly. Servers have great knowledge of the food and their origins. The wine list has many high end options even for per-glass. The chef is part of Dom Perignon society apparently. Per cuisine, the menu is a celebration of Mexican food. Everything from the tortillas to beans tastes so good. The most memorable dishes for me were potato soup with caviar, mole sauces, and tamales and chocolate dessert. The desserts here hand down are the best that I have had this year.
Poem: Here is the poem referencing the restaurant and review highlights, followed by the most mentioned dish:
Popular Dish/Drink:
Californios, oh Californios
Your moles and esquites sing
Caviar, tacos divine 
Sweet memories they bring

Cotton candy paleta

Name: Copra
Address: 1700 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
Review Text:
We had a lovely birthday celebration here of a friend's milestone moment. It was a perfect place to celebrate.
The location is at a quaint neighborhood. The decor is Bohemian with natural jute ropes entangled beautifully with greenery around. It made some beautiful pictures.
The entire course of food was delicious. I became a fan of the papads and the different chutneys. The appetizers to the main courses were also exotic, coconut heavy and superb. I loved a shrimp appetizer and was a total fan of the chicken biryani and a fish entree. I found the dessert a little too cold, which was rice pudding on a bed of ice. Otherwise an awesome place to tingle all those taste buds with a fantastic crew of helpful folks and an amazing ambience to enjoy. Definitely going back.
Poem: Here is the poem response in paragraph 1 and the dish name in paragraph 2:
Popular Dish/Drink:
Celebrating friends with food and flair
At Copra, flavors abound without a care
Cocktails and curios entice the tastebuds
As coconut and seafood have guests singing puds
Ambience delights with greenery and rope
Creating moments worthy of birthday hope

chicken biryani

Wonderful place to eat fresh lovely fish and shellfish.
Fast, polite and attentive service.
We sat by the bar and the barmen were brilliant. The mixed fish â€œcacciuccoâ€ style dish was beautiful. I thought I was in Italy.
Beautiful Oysters and prawns too. A true feast of delicious seafood.
Could not have had a better lunch.
Will definitely return there.

I prefer the king Henry cut, seared, but canâ€™t really go wrong.

Name: Kin Khao
Address: 55 Cyril Magnin St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
Review Text:
We had a wonderful meal at Kin Khao. We had thought it unlikely we would be able to eat here as we had not made reservations, however there is a communal table in the middle of the restaurant for people without reservations. We sat here and loved it.

My friend and I ordered a range of dishes along with a few cocktails. We shared all of the food and everything was delicious. Our waitress was really knowledgeable and gave a couple of really good recommendations that were appreciated. She also perfectly guided us to the correct ordering quantity.

Great spot
Poem: Here is the poem referencing Kin Khao and highlights from the reviews, followed by the most mentioned dish:
Popular Dish/Drink:
Kin Khao, a tasty spot
With flavors that hit the spot
Attentive wait staff abound
Delicious dishes all around
Black rice pudding takes the crown

Black rice pudding

Maison Nico is a bakery experience like no other. Their croissants are simply incredible â€“ better than any Iâ€™ve had, even in Paris! I picked up a pumpkin croissant during my trip to San Francisco, and Iâ€™m savoring every bit of it at home. The layers are perfectly flaky, and the flavor is rich and balanced.

Their chocolate croissant is just as amazing, and the almond financiers are a delightful treat. If youâ€™re a pastry lover, Maison Nico is a must-visit â€“ truly exceptional!

Review Text:
For Burmese food in SF, this is a top spot. The drinks were on point and overall a good experience.

Food was definitely well seasoned without anything being too salty. The tea salad was quite interesting and reminded me a bit of Indian chaat. Rice is not included so may need to order some on the side to go with the dishes.

Staff was very friendly and bathroom was clean. Reservation is recommended.

With tea leaf salad and rainbows that fill
Basil beef too sweet, noodles a bore  
But fried rice and chicken walnuts score

Name: Merchant Roots
Address: 1148 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM
Review Text: My coworker had booked this amazing food experience a couple months in advance. The reviews were so positive I couldn't wait to try what was on the menu. I love a good 12 course/bougie meal so I definitely couldn't pass this up! From the second we all walked in,the service and attention to detail was immaculate. One of my coworkers had a tomato allergy and I am so grateful that they accomodated her esp for the theme of pasta&stories. I don't like to drink so I had the 12 course meal with non alcoholic pairing and each dish& drink was so thoughtful and carefully curated. I don't want to spoil it but I am not a pasta person but after the dinner,I am sold. Pasta all day!!!ğŸ˜ I can't wait to attend again!

Merchant Roots, a feast for the senses
Plates of art, flavors intense
Service superb, attention immense 
Transporting guests to realms immense

pasta

I came here with my family, and itâ€™s a great fast-casual spot! The host at the front was super friendly and took our orders before seating us, which seems to be their usual process. Because of this setup, thereâ€™s no service charge, which was a nice surprise.

Once seated, the staff brought the food directly to our table, and we enjoyed every dish. The appetizers, in particular, were a standoutâ€”they were definitely our favorites over the mains. Overall, it was a great experience, and weâ€™ll definitely be back!

Name: Piglet & Co
Address: 2170 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰9:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰9:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯PM
Review Text:
Found this place last year while visiting the city and it peaked my interest seeing a Taiwanese fusion restaurant. You donâ€™t see this often, so we had to check it out being Taiwanese myself.

I love what they are trying to do with Taiwanese food. Elevating dishes and new takes on some traditional comfort foods. The milk tea French toast was honestly my favorite. The boba was on point, the toast was nicely fried on the outside and soft on the inside. And the jam really pulled everything together. The rice porridge and lu ro fan were good, however, the portions were a bit small for the price. I think if this can be balanced it would be perfect.

Overall, Iâ€™d come back again to try their other popular dishes. They do rotate their menu, so thereâ€™s always something different they offer.
Poem: Here is the poem referencing the restaurant and review highlights, followed by the most mentioned dish:
Popular Dish/Drink:
Piglet brings the flavors, fusion done right
Taiwanese cuisine with a modern bite
Milk tea French toast and lu rou fan
Creative dishes for the adventurous clan

lu rou fan

Review Text: We enjoyed the live music on the patio on a Thursday night. A talented acoustic guitarist, not too loud that it disrupted conversation. For food, the noodle dish - Tataki(?) - was SO good. Mushroomy and delicious, a large serving. We ordered three things between two people and were stuffed, had to take it to go. I didnâ€™t like the Koko wings very much â€” the spice coating was a bit dry and the meat over cooked. I also didnâ€™t love the Chicken Kelaguen; they didnâ€™t have enough flavor. But rhetorical noodles, yum. Service was extremely good, almost overly attentive. They have a good mocktail/NA menu.

Now, letâ€™s get into that muffuletta, â€™cause this sandwich? Itâ€™s giving EVERYTHING itâ€™s supposed to give, okurrr! And donâ€™t even get me started on the breadâ€”itâ€™s crispy, itâ€™s soft, itâ€™s perfection!

If youâ€™re in New Orleans and you ainâ€™t hit up Sandyâ€™s yet, what is you doinâ€™, baby? This muffuletta is a whole experience, and you need it in your life! So, go on, treat yourself, and thank me later! Period!

Review Text: Really great crab! Right when you walk in, youâ€™re punched in the face with an incredibly fragrant garlic aroma. Sides and apps were great, but the star of the show was this incredible dungeoness crab. Wow. Garlicky, peppery, buttery, and just hot enough to have to take care (at the beginning). A true feast for the senses. Smell, texture, sight, taste - everything is activated simultaneously when this dish arrives. Not much else to report. Just a simple, excellent crab dish and worth repeating as often as possible.

Review Text: I wanted to try something new, I always past by this place, so I finally tried it. They have a serving counter where they make your plate in front of you. I enjoyed the turkey sloppy Joe; I felt like I was back at Grandma's house. The interior is hip, I liked the decor. People had there children eating there too, so it is family friendly. Try something new!
Poem: Here is the poem referencing Tommy's Joynt and review highlights, followed by the most mentioned dish:
Popular Dish/Drink:
Ode to Tommy's Joynt
With counters piled high, plates made before your eyes
Grandma's sloppy Joe brings back memories of pies
The Reuben though, swimming in dressing, no zing to the kraut
Stale bread and cold meat brought disappointment, no doubt
This classic joint's decor delight, but the pastrami was not right

Review Text: I wanted to try something new, I always past by this place, so I finally tried it. They have a serving counter where they make your plate in front of you. I enjoyed the turkey sloppy Joe; I felt like I was back at Grandma's house. The interior is hip, I liked the decor. People had there children eating there too, so it is family friendly. Try something new!
Poem: Here is the poem referencing Tommy's Joynt and review highlights, followed by the most mentioned dish:
Popular Dish/Drink:
Ode to Tommy's Joynt
With counters piled high, plates made before your eyes
Grandma's sloppy Joe brings back memories of pies
The Reuben though, swimming in dressing, no zing to the kraut
Stale bread and cold meat brought disappointment, no doubt
This classic joint's decor delight, but the pastrami was not right

Review Text:
The location of Zuni within is an absolute gem, wedged on a shear corner lot on Market, the building has authentic bones that gives nearly a 360Â° perch on this spot in the city.

We ordered the fig popover, lamb chickpea soup of the day, and polenta, all fantastic with unique stand-alone flavor profiles. I loved the soup so much, I will probably go back to buy the cookbook. For a Sunday brunch, the place wasnâ€™t too busy, so the environment was very relaxed.

Lived in the city for five years and always seen the spot while passing through, but finally glad it took a friend visiting to discover this great spot.
